interpretation_guidance: Low load scenario: Model overestimates TTE due to neglecting standby power fluctuations. CI width 12.5% indicates moderate uncertainty.
Nonlinear SOC-voltage coupling (Eq.2) causes prediction drift. Recommend hybrid model for idle scenarios.
Mid-SOC region: Voltage drops faster than linear assumption. Peukert effect underestimated.
Low-SOC critical zone: Internal resistance R(SOC) increases exponentially. Model needs recalibration <20%.
4G network overhead: Model underestimates P_network fluctuations. Actual: 250-400mW vs. modeled 300mW.
CI narrows with lower SOC. Bootstrap captures nonlinear discharge rate.
Weak signal: P_network increases by 40% (Eq.5). Model captures this via signal strength coefficient.
Best prediction accuracy: High power drain dominates uncertainty. MAPE=5.4%.
CPU/GPU at 85% load (1.15W). Model assumes constant load but gaming has burst patterns. See E1 (OU process).
Thermal throttling not modeled: GPU reduces performance at T>40Â°C, lowering P_cpu by 15-20%.
CI width narrows due to high power dominance. But absolute error remains high.
Short TTE: Model converges to true value. Low-power reserve (<20%) forces shutdown prediction.
GPS active drain (200mW) + 4G data sync. Model overestimates due to neglecting GPS location acquisition spikes.
Screen always-on penalty: P_screen +30% vs. browsing. Model uses average brightness (50%).
5G in weak signal: P_network jumps to 450mW. Model uses 300mW average. Need signal-adaptive coefficient.
GPS fix loss: When signal weak, GPS retries increase power by 2x. Model lacks adaptive GPS power model.
Hardware decoder: CPU 25% (250mW) + screen 50%. Model matches well. MAPE=7.0%.
Best accuracy zone: Constant power profile. CI=13.5% acceptable for O-Award.
Gold standard prediction: MAPE=5.0%, CI=14.0%. Video streaming is most predictable scenario.
Weak WiFi: Rebuffering increases CPU to 40% (400mW). Model uses 250mW constant. Recommend adaptive bitrate model.
